Articles.Content:
I really like the game and registered here a few days ago, after several successful missions (Mun, Minmus, Orbit). Now I wanted to dedicate my first post for the "In Memory of Neil"-Challenge, but somehow I'm not allow to do that.

Nevertheless - here I am and I hope this awesome game get better and better.

Until you reach 5 posts, your posts are placed in a moderation queue. Once reviewed by a Moderator to ensure you aren't a spammer (we have to fight them off all day long), your post will appear. Once you've hit 5 posts, your account will be upgraded from Curious George to Bottle Rocketeer and the post restrictions will be lifted.

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
I've had this problem too, now I know why. It makes sense, kinda like I have to earn the privilege! Time to do more posting than lurking.
Thank you Capt'n Skunky for the clarification. In the meantime my post was reviewed. Thank you forum-team (and Squad).

Just a quick question here, Skunky. I'm prettys sure I have more than 5 posts by now, but sometimes I still get a message that says that a moderator must approve it first. Is this something that applies for special threads, or is it a bug?

Cheers

Just a quick question here, Skunky. I'm prettys sure I have more than 5 posts by now, but sometimes I still get a message that says that a moderator must approve it first. Is this something that applies for special threads, or is it a bug?

Cheers

I think it's for special threads. I kept getting that and I have over 500 posts.
